com.cloudera.oryx.common.io

Class IOUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cloudera.oryx.common.io.IOUtils

  • public final class IOUtils
extends Object
    Simple utility methods related to I/O.
    Author:
    Sean Owen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static FilenameFilter NOT_HIDDEN
      A FilenameFilter that accepts files whose name does not start with "."

      • NOT_HIDDEN

        public static final FilenameFilter NOT_HIDDEN
        A FilenameFilter that accepts files whose name does not start with "."

    • Method Detail

      • deleteRecursively

        public static void deleteRecursively(File dir)
                              throws IOException
        Attempts to recursively delete a directory. This may not work across symlinks.
        Parameters:
        dir - directory to delete along with contents
        Throws:
        IOException - if any deletion fails

      • delete

        public static void delete(File file)
                   throws IOException
        Like File.delete() but throws an exception if the operation fails.
        Parameters:
        file - file to delete
        Throws:
        IOException - if deletion fails

      • openMaybeDecompressing

        public static InputStream openMaybeDecompressing(File file)
                                          throws IOException
        Opens an InputStream to the file. If it appears to be compressed, because its file name ends in ".gz" or ".zip", then it will be decompressed accordingly
        Parameters:
        file - file, possibly compressed, to open
        Returns:
        InputStream on uncompressed contents
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream can't be opened or is invalid or can't be read

      • openReaderMaybeDecompressing

        public static Reader openReaderMaybeDecompressing(File file)
                                           throws IOException
        Parameters:
        file - file, possibly compressed, to open
        Returns:
        Reader on uncompressed contents
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream can't be opened or is invalid or can't be read
        See Also:
        openMaybeDecompressing(File)

      • copyStreamToFile

        public static void copyStreamToFile(InputStream in,
                    File file)
                             throws IOException
        Parameters:
        in - stream to read and copy
        file - file to write stream's contents to
        Throws:
        IOException - if the stream can't be read or the file can't be written

      • copyURLToFile

        public static void copyURLToFile(URL url,
                 File file)
                          throws IOException
        Parameters:
        url - URL whose contents are to be read and copied
        file - file to write contents to
        Throws:
        IOException - if the URL can't be read or the file can't be written

      • mkdirs

        public static void mkdirs(File dir)
                   throws IOException
        Like File.mkdirs() but throws IOException if the operation fails.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buildGZIPOutputStream

        public static GZIPOutputStream buildGZIPOutputStream(OutputStream delegate)
                                              throws IOException
        Parameters:
        delegate - OutputStream to wrap
        Returns:
        a GZIPOutputStream wrapping the given OutputStream. It attempts to use the new Java 7 version that actually responds to OutputStream.flush() as expected. If not available, uses the previous version (GZIPOutputStream.GZIPOutputStream(OutputStream))
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buildGZIPWriter

        public static Writer buildGZIPWriter(OutputStream delegate)
                              throws IOException
        Parameters:
        delegate - OutputStream to wrap
        Returns:
        the result of buildGZIPOutputStream(OutputStream) as a Writer that encodes using UTF-8 encoding
        Throws:
        IOException

      • buildGZIPWriter

        public static Writer buildGZIPWriter(File file)
                              throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException
        See Also:
        buildGZIPWriter(OutputStream)

      • buffer

        public static BufferedReader buffer(Reader maybeBuffered)
        Wraps its argument in BufferedReader if not already one.

      • isGZIPFileEmpty

        public static boolean isGZIPFileEmpty(File f)
                               throws IOException
        Returns:
        true iff the given file is a gzip-compressed file with no content; the file itself may not be empty because it contains gzip headers and footers
        Throws:
        IOException - if the file is not a gzip file or can't be read
